remarks: Definition of infinite Cartesian product of [Enderton] p. 54.  Enderton uses a bold "X" with ` x e. A ` written underneath or as a subscript, as does Stoll p. 47.  Some books use a capital pi, but we will reserve that notation for products of numbers.  Usually ` B ` represents a class expression containing ` x ` free and thus can be thought of as ` B ( x ) ` .  Normally, ` x ` is not free in ` A ` , although this is not a requirement of the definition.  (Contributed by NM, 28-Sep-2006.)
statement:
df-ixp $p |- X_ x e. A B = { f | ( f Fn { x | x e. A } /\ A. x e. A ( f ` x ) e. B ) } $.
$d A f $.
$d B f $.
$d f x $.
